1.text: Do you know at what time the wild goats have given birth among the rocks, or do you observe the deer when they go into labor?

2.text: Have you numbered the months since their conception, and do you know at what time they gave birth?

3.text: They bend themselves for their offspring, and they give birth, and they emit roars.

4.text: Their young are weaned and go out to feed; they depart and do not return to them.

5.text: Who has set the wild ass free, and who has released his bonds?

6.text: I have given a house in solitude to him, and his tabernacle is in the salted land.

7.text: He despises the crowded city; he does not pay attention to the bellow of the tax collector.

8.text: He looks around the mountains of his pasture, and he searches everywhere for green plants.

9.text: Will the rhinoceros be willing to serve you, and will he remain in your stall?

10.text: Can you detain the rhinoceros with your harness to plough for you, and will he loosen the soil of the furrows behind you?

11.text: Will you put your faith in his great strength, and delegate your labors to him?

12.text: Will you trust him to return to you the seed, and to gather it on your drying floor?

13.text: The wing of the ostrich is like the wings of the heron, and of the hawk.

14.text: When she leaves eggs behind in the earth, will you perhaps warm them in the dust?

15.text: She forgets that feet may trample them, or that the beasts of the field may shatter them.

16.text: She is hardened against her young, as if they were not hers; she has labored in vain, with no fear compelling her.

17.text: For God has deprived her of wisdom; neither has he given her understanding.

18.text: Yet, when the time is right, she raises her wings on high; she ridicules the horse and his rider.

19.text: Will you supply strength to the horse, or envelope his throat with neighing?

20.text: Will you alarm him as the locusts do? His panic is revealed by the display of his nostrils.

21.text: He digs at the earth with his hoof; he jumps around boldly; he advances to meet armed men.

22.text: He despises fear; he does not turn away from the sword.

23.text: Above him, the quiver rattles, the spear and the shield shake.

24.text: Seething and raging, he drinks up the earth; neither does he pause when the blast of the trumpet sounds.

25.text: When he hears the bugle, he says, “Ha!” He smells the battle from a distance, the exhortation of the officers, and the battle cry of the soldiers.

26.text: Does the hawk grow feathers by means of your wisdom, spreading her wings towards the south?

27.text: Will the eagle lift herself up at your command and make her nest in steep places?

28.text: She dwells among the rocks, and she lingers among broken boulders and inaccessible cliffs.

29.text: From there, she looks for food, and her eyes catch sight of it from far away.

30.text: Her young will drink blood, and wherever the carcass will be, she is there immediately.
